item.title: 3 Men Run Across the Sahara Dessert
item.description: Three runners ran for 111 days straight covering six countries and over 4,000 miles across the Sahara Desert. Their mission was to raise awareness of the need for clean water supplies in Africa. They started the trip by touching the water in Senegal and ended by touching the Red Sea in Egypt. The trip began in Senegal and ended at the Red Sea in Cairo Egypt. Charlie Engle from the US, Ray Zahab from Canada, and Kevin Lin from Taiwan are three of the best endurance runners in the world and the trip across the Sahara had never been done before. A documentary called "Running the Sahara" will chronicle their adventure. The LivePlanet production, narrated by Academy Award Winner Matt Damon, is scheduled for release in 2007.
item.author: webmaster@dwjtv.com

item.title: Holiday Entertaining with Marc Silverstein, host of Food Network’s the Best Of
item.description:
The holiday season is approaching quickly, and before you know it, friends and family will be gathering at holiday parties. This year, consider a new twist on entertaining and forget the main course. “The truth of the matter is that there is no better way to please a crowd than to simply offer appetizers and desserts, says Food Network host Marc Silverstein. You can mix it up with store bought delicacies as well as easy-to-make recipes. It’s way simpler than a formal sit-down dinner, and a refreshing change. Silverstein offers tips on how to prepare creative holiday appetizers and desserts, get the kids involved, and make your next party a memorable one.
For more information on entertaining your friends & family this holiday season, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Holiday Entertaining segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on the binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: HOLIDAY ENTERTAINING.

item.title: Fall Fix It with Jodi Marks, co-host of HGTV’s "Fix It Up"
item.description:
Americans spend more than $220 billion a year fixing up their homes, whether for beautification, safety, energy savings or simply extending living space. What better time than now to fix up the inside and outside of your home. There are many cost effective home improvement projects that will help you enjoy your home for many years to come.
Not all improvements have to come at a great cost to homeowners, says Jodi Marks, who was raised in her family’s construction business, and now is co-host of the Fix It Up series on Home & Garden Television.
Marks discusses how to easily spruce up a room, kitchen and bathroom renovation ideas, and how to finance home improvement projects.
For more information on fall home improvements, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Fall Fix It segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on the binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Fall Fix It.

item.title: Medicine Cabinet Makeover with Dr. Janet Engle
item.description:
Is your medicine cabinet stocked for any emergency? Pharmacist Janet Engle, the Past President of the American Pharmacists Association, says that it’s very important to know what’s inside your medicine cabinet.
Out with the old and in with the new, says Dr. Engle. If it’s been more than a year since the medicine cabinet was cleaned out, it’s long overdue.
Engle offers advice on what you should keep and what you should discard. She also dispenses some safety information on medicines.
For more information on medicine cabinet makeovers, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Medicine Cabinet Makeover segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on the binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Medicine Cabinet Makeover.

item.title: Family Breakfast with Robin Kline, Dietician
item.description:
Fall’s busy schedules are in full swing. And that could mean sharing a family meal may be hard to pull off. But there’s a surprising new opportunity. Consider eating breakfast together.
The mornings are usually the one time of day when families can count on everyone being home. So why not turn that family dinner hour into a family breakfast hour?
Dietician Robin Kline talks about why it’s so important to get your family together for meals. She also offers tips on how to get a delicious breakfast prepared in minutes- so you can spend more time enjoying it with your family!
For more information on getting your family together for breakfast, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Family Breakfast segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on the binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Family Breakfast.

item.title: Energy Awareness Month with Brad Staggs, DIY Network Host
item.description:
October is the official Energy Awareness Month. And it’s the perfect time to focus your attention on home heating costs that could bear a burden this winter. The good news is that there is still time to make sure your energy bill doesn’t go through the roof.
From do-it-yourself projects to those that require more work and professional installation, Brad Staggs, host of Talk2diy Home Improvement on DIY Network, offers some sound advice to help keep your money from slipping through the cracks this winter.
For more information on energy efficiency, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Energy Awareness Month segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on the binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Energy Awareness Month.

item.title: Fall Car Care with Lauren Fix, the Car Coach
item.description:
The Car Care Council has officially declared October ‘Fall Car Care Month.’ It’s the perfect time to focus attention on the importance of preparing your vehicle for the colder days ahead and carpooling to work, school, and other activities.
When the leaves start falling and the weather turns cool, every car or truck owner needs to consider the 4-C’s of car care, says Car Coach Lauren Fix. It’s simple. Check, change, carry, and clean.
For more information on fall car care, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Car Care segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on the binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Car Care.

item.title: Raising Baby: A parent’s ultimate play time guide
item.description:
Babies eat, sleep, and cry.A LOT! And many parents allow the stress of a new baby to overwhelm them. But parenthood can also be a lot of fun and play time is a great way for mom and baby to bond and relax.
The wonderful thing about young babies is that they have a foolproof, built-in system that tells their parents when they are learning and developing properly - they're happy, says parenting guru and author Betsy Hart, who writes a nationally syndicated column for Scripps Howards News Service.
Hart encourages parents to trust their instincts and balance their needs with their baby’s.
For more information on surviving a new baby, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our New Baby segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: New Baby.

item.title: Fuel for School with Jill Melton, MS, RD, Editor of Relish Magazine
item.description:
In a few weeks, kids will be heading back to school. And for parents that means a morning rush, and an even greater need to help their children eat right.
Getting kids to eat healthy is especially important during the school year, notes Jill Melton, MS, RD and Editor of Relish Magazine. Food is directly related to brain function, academic performance and energy levels.
For more information on back to school nutrition, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our School Fuel segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: School Fuel.

item.title: Top Tools For School: Smart Supplies for the New School Year
item.description:
It's that time of year again - time to hit the books. But whether it's your first day of kindergarten or you're wrapping up your last semester at college, being armed and ready with the latest school supplies will start the school year off on the right foot.
Supplies have come a long way since the pencil box and trapperkeeper says Steve Greenberg, the Innovation Insider. In fact, they seem to be just as smart as the students themselves! Technology has come a long way.
For more information on back to school shopping, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our School Shopping segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: School Shopping.

item.title: Getting Organized: Dorm Room Do-Over
item.description:
Laptops, notebooks, CD’s, laundry and soda cans all part of the landscape we call a dorm room. But starting off on the right foot this semester can enhance your space and may even improve your grades.
There’s something to say about being organized. When we’re not, we spend so much time and energy trying to locate or sort through our messes. This is especially important for students says Ronni Eisenberg, The Ultimate Organizer.
For more information on dorm room makeovers, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Dorm Room Makeover segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Dorm Room Makeovers.

item.title: Back Yard Makeovers: Tips and Tricks to Help Spruce Up Your Space
item.description:
The warmer weather is finally here! It's time to get rid of a winter's worth of dust and grime. Unfortunately, it's also the time of year when we all want to be outside enjoying the fresh air. The last thing on our minds is cleaning or doing major work around the house. But the good news is that a back yard makeover doesn’t have to cost you a lot of time or money. America’s Home Improvement expert, Lynda Lyday will provide viewers with a gamelan that will help everyone to be able to clean up quickly and efficiently, with plenty of time left over to stop and smell the newly budding roses. Who is Lynda Lyday? A Southern bred lady, she wasn’t allowed to be seen with a hammer. But she needed a day job when she moved to The Big Apple to pursue an acting career. She joined the Carpenters Union, launched a construction company, designed her own tool line, authored books and became carpenter/host for a number of television programs. Her wit and wisdom have kept her busy with appearances on CNN, ABC, CBS and NBC news stations.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search, highlight DWJ Archive, and use keywords: Backyard Makeovers.
item.author: webmaster@dwjtv.com

item.title: Great Gift Ideas for Grads and Dads
item.description:
It's that time of the year to start looking for great gifts for Fathers Day and graduation. This year, skip the tie and gift certificate route and go with something tech-related.
Technology is becoming smaller and easier to operate in general, says Steve Greenberg, The Innovation Insider.
Among Greenberg's hot gift ideas are:
- Camcorders with built-in hard drive and expandable memory
- DVD recorders that update with new movies every week
- Cell phones with built-in MP3 players
- Electric toothbrushes that tell you when to change the brush head
- An iPod case that lets you listen under water
- A gadget that helps golfers find a lost ball
For more information on Greenberg's Dads and Grads ideas, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Dads and Grads segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search, highlight DWJ Archive, and use keywords: Dads and Grads.

item.title: Summer Grilling Short Cuts
item.description:
Although summer entertaining seems like a breeze, planning ahead is important if you want to keep your cool.
You don't have to leave home to soak up the summer, says Food Network host Marc Silverstein. Have a casual backyard BBQ, with appetizers and buffet style meals. No pressure, just good food.
While it's always tempting to just open the grill and slap on some meat, America is still a diet-crazed nation, and eating healthy is on everyone's mind. After all, it's swimsuit season. From grilling light to packing on-the-go picnics, Silverstein can offer viewers the following tips:
- Creative ways to host hot parties
- How to choose the right meats, veggies, and buns for delicious (and light!) summer grilling
- How to avoid packing on the pounds.
For more information on Marc's Summer Grilling Shortcuts, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Summer Grilling segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search tab, highlight DWJ archive, and use keywords: Summer Grilling

item.title: ARE WE THERE YET? Planning the Perfect Last Minute Safe Family Vacation
item.description:
The kids have wrapped up their school year and the pressure to plan a fun family vacation is on.
If you haven't firmed up your plans it's not too late for a last minute family trip that is fun, economical and safe.
When you take a family vacation, you have to consider who you're traveling with, says Lynn Hayes, editor of FamilyTravel.com. Kids want to be entertained, and believe it or not, there are great trips you can plan that will keep everyone smiling. Hayes gives viewers great last minute trip ideas that won't break the bank or tack on stress. She knows the importance of safety and can offer viewers some helpful tips that are sure to make the next family vacation the most memorable one yet.
Lynn Hayes gives viewers advice on the best ways to:
- Know where to find the best deals - Think outside the box and try something new - Escape our crazy, technology driven lives (no cell phones, no TV, no internet!) - Focus on the family's interests as a whole - Keep your family safe on the road
For more information on Hayes' Summer Travel ideas, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Summer Travel segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search, highlight DWJ Archive, and use keywords: Summer Travel.
item.author: webmaster@dwjtv.com

item.title: Balding in America: Treatments Have Come A Long Way
item.description: For men who are losing their hair, it is no laughing matter. For some, it starts in their late teens and by age 50, about half of all men will be losing their hair. In 95 percent of the cases, classic male pattern hair loss is to blame. College student Ryan Mongon, 21, tries to laugh off the jokes about his receding hairline and hides under a baseball cap whenever he appears in public. But unlike many men, he decided to do something about it. Enter Dr. Kenneth Washenik, M.D., PhD, a professor at New York University who specializes in hair loss and its causes. In this podcast, Ryan tells his story and Dr. Washenik explains why Ryan is losing his hair and points out that hair loss treatments have come a long way in the last two decades. If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search, highlight DWJ Archive, and use keywords: Hair Loss, Hairloss Balding, Hair Transplant.
item.author: webmaster@dwjtv.com

item.title: Homebuilding Premier Conference and Tradeshow Hot Summer Spruce Up's With Home Improvement Guru, Brad Staggs
item.description:
It's summer and the last thing on everyone's mind is doing work around the house. But the truth is there's no hotter time to get things looking good around your home and the 2006 Pacific Builder's Show has the latest products to kick off your summer the right way!
From Do-it-yourself projects, to those that require a little more work, Home Improvement Guru, Brad Staggs, host of Talk2diy Home Improvement on DIY Network, will tell you about some must have's for the house.
Brad gives viewers insight on:
- The latest trends for 2006
- How to make your home safer
- How to save money
For more information on Staggs' Home Improvement ideas, go to www.moreaboutthat.info, click on our Home Improvement segment and then download our podcast to see the segment online.
If you are a news station and have access to Pathfire, this story is also available on Pathfire DMG. Click on binoculars, select advanced search, highlight DWJ Archive, and use keywords: HOME IMPROVEMENT
